original_title: Brooklyn: Myrtle Avenue - St. Edward's Street
text:
Myrtle Avenue, north side, east from St. Edwards Street to North Elliott Place. The corner house is a very old dwelling. These buildings will be torn down and on their site erected the Fort Greene Houses, a low-rent housing project.
View 1: October 12, 1940.
View 2,3: September 6, 1939
P. L. Sperr
View 3 shows the frame house on the corner, seen from North Elliott Place.

Fort Greene Park (Brooklyn): Viewing north across the park toward Myrtle Avenue ("El" thereon) and St. Edwards Street. In the distance is the Lower Manhattan skyline; in the left background, several Brooklyn skyscrapers.
View 2 shows the Prison Ship Martyrs Monument.

P. L. Sperr

April 27, 1940
Views 1,2
title: Brooklyn: Fort Greene Park.

title: Brooklyn: Fort Greene Park.

text:
Fort Greene Park (Brooklyn): Viewing north across the park, under construction, toward Myrtle Avenue ("El" thereon) and St. Edwards Street.  The twin-towered structure across the "El" is St. Edwards Church and beyond that is the Manhattan Bridge.  IN the left background is the skyline of Lower Manhattan.  View 2 is in the same direction as view 1 and shows the park when completed.  View 3 is in a more easterly direction and shows the Cumberland Hospital, in Auburn Place.

View 1: October 20, 1935
Views 2,3: April 27, 1940

P.L. Sperr
title: Brooklyn: Fort Greene Park.

original_title: Brooklyn: St. Edwards Street - Myrtle Avenue
text:
St. Edwards Street, north from Myrtle Avenue. View 1 shows the east side of the avenue with the south wing of Public School No. 67 on the extreme left and the New Cumberland Hospital in the right background; view 2 shows the west side of the street and St. Edwards Roman Catholic Church, at Leo Place.

P. L. Sperr

October 12, 1940
Views 1,2
View 3: October 10, 1940

View 3 is north on St. Edwards Street, across Myrtle Avenue, from Fort Greene Park.

original_title: Brooklyn: Myrtle Avenue - St. Edward's Place
text:
1. Myrtle Ave. & St. Edwards St., n.w. corner, Bklyn.
Neg. A-125  Apr. 11, 1941
P.L. Sperr, photographer

original_title: Brooklyn: Myrtle Avenue - St. Edward's Street
text:
Myrtle Avenue, north side, west from St. Edward's Place, showing the clearance, created by the demolition of all the buildings that stood here. Fort Greene Houses, a government sponsored project, will rise here.

View 2 is west from Leo Place and View 3 from Hudson Avenue. The "El" is on Myrtle Avenue.

P. L. Sperr

April 22, 1941
Views 1,2,3
